children.subject: I took 168 last semester and also talked to Prof Ratnasamy in OH and they mentioned this. You could try getting in touch with whoever is teaching it next (Prof Shenker??) to be sure.

If I'm not mistaken they're revamping 168 to be more in depth than previous offerings, so that's why they're making 162 a prereq. You could probably take the new 168 without 162, but up to individual to know if they're comfortable with that.

history.content:
I took CS 168 last semester without having taken 162 (the only other CS upperdiv I had completed before was 170), and I ended up doing well in the class.  There wasn't a single instance where I felt I lacked knowledge that was expected of us from a previous course.  You can check out this link for last semester's class that contains the material we went through. http://www-inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/~cs168/fa14/

From Scott Shenker:

162 will no longer be a “formal” prerequisite. However, we expect students to be able to handle programming projects.  The 168 projects are not terribly difficult, but if you’ve done 162 then they will be straightforward.  If you haven’t done 162 then it is up to you to make sure you can handle them.

I took CS 168 last semester without having taken 162 (the only other CS upperdiv I had completed before was 170), and I ended up doing well in the class.  There wasn't a single instance where I felt I lacked knowledge that was expected of us from a previous course.  You can check out this link for last semester's class that contains the material we went through. http://www-inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/~cs168/fa14/

I noticed that CS 162 (Operating Systems) is a prereq for CS 168 (Intro to the Internet & Architecture Protocols)

1. Is it actually required or will I be able to enroll in 168 without having taken 162?

2. For students who have taken 168, did you feel that 162 was necessary to do well in 168?
history.subject: CS 162 prereq for CS 168?
